boat.name: Katie
boat.full_description:
Fortuna, a gaff cutter, was found off Cockham Slip upstream of Hoo on the Medway. She was owned by Dr Clark and her blue Registration Book showed she had been built in 1880 as a steam launch. Subsequently she had been converted to a yacht. It was decided to give her a third reincarnation and make a plug from her to build a new class of yachts to race on the Thames.

Harry Hutchinson found Katie as an abandoned project on the Thames and took her to Lymington. Subsequently she moved to the East Coast with new owners, in 2010, and sailed regularly in OGA events. She was sold in 2016.

Her sister ship, Chickpea, has been fitted out for cruising with a cabin.
boat.short_description: Katie is one of only two Baltic One Design GRP gaff cutters taken off the hull of gentleman's cutter 'Fortuna'.

for_sales.sales_text:
"Katie is a 30" (LOD) gaff-rigged cutter, built 1990, with hull and deck in GRP. The plug was an original Victorian Gentleman"s Cutter, "Fortuna" (circa 1880).

She has two forward berth and a sea toilet, and the large cockpit doubles as 2 extra berths and saloon in which there is cooker/sink/cool compartment and stowage. The cockpit is enclosed with a two-part tent in harbour or a spray hood, if wished, at sea.

She is equipped with a Yanmar IGM 10 diesel engine and stainless steel 80 litre fuel tank, a s/s 180 litre water tank, and holding tank. "Katie" carries a suit of seven sails, including a new unused jib (2015).

Lying ashore, Walton on the Naze.
